web.title: Clubhouse UCLA
web.description: An online platform for reviewing UCLA student organizations, built to make campus involvement more transparent. I led end-to-end development across the stack, including APIs, auth, deployment, and core features. Future updates include user profiles and club recommendations.

web.title: UCLA Student Affairs
web.description: Student developer for UCLA Student Affairs websites. I work across multiple sites building reusable components, fixing bugs, and implementing accessibility improvements to make the experience more inclusive and reliable.

web.title: Michael Dean Wilkins
web.description: A freelance portfolio site for an LA-based photographer. I designed and built the site using a headless CMS to enable easy content management, with a focus on performance, scalability, and a modern, responsive design.

web.title: bunnyluv1
web.description: My personal website, featuring a playable tamagotchi game, creative portfolio, blog, and more. This was one of my first programming projects ever, and is still growing! Currently undergoing a refactor from plain HTML/CSS/JS to Astro.js.

web.title: Morii - Moments That Stay
web.description: A mobile app for sharing and tracking emotions, analyzing mood patterns, and staying connected with your community. I built backend endpoints for social features like posts, likes, comments, and admin-authenticated block/report tools to support safe interactions. Available on the app store!

games.title: SynthSlicer
games.description: A rhythm-based slicing game with procedurally generated beatmaps from user-uploaded audio. I implemented level selection, custom audio upload, and pause/play controls, and contributed to the visual design of scoring, hit feedback, and color themes.
